page.title: 05TRADE
page.content: The area is{agricultural}therefore the major trade is{farming.}Many farmers have licences to sell their products on stalls, either on the farm or in lay-bys by the Gloucester to Chepstow road. There one can buy produce such as apples, plums, strawberries and tomatoes. On the north side of the river there is a{stable}which trades in horses. A similar situation in trade exists on the south side of the river.The nearest{factory}was Cadbury's at Frampton but that was sold off into smaller units. Shoppers have to go elsewhere because of lack of facilities. They may get basic foodstuffs at Arlingham, Saul or Frampton. The population on both sides of the river needs to travel to Gloucester, Stroud or Lydney for most shopping.
